byline.contributor: James Kanter contributed reporting from Brussels, Aurelien Breeden from Paris, and Niki Kitsantonis from Athens.
byline.original: By ANDREW HIGGINS and ALISON SMALE

abstract: European Union, day before Greece is set to default on repayment of bailout loan, makes last-minute proposal that offers some concessions in return for Greek Prime Min Alex Tsipras's acceptance of creditors' demands, which he has already rejected; Greek officials do not indicate how government will respond.
lead_paragraph: European officials said a deal was still possible to settle Greece’s debt crisis, but gave no indication that it could happen before Greece runs out of cash to pay loans due Tuesday.

headline.main: With Loan Deadline Looming, Europe Offers Greece a Last-Minute Deal
headline.print_headline: With Loan Deadline Looming, Europe Offers Greece a Last-Minute Deal

snippet: European officials said a deal was still possible to settle Greece’s debt crisis, but gave no indication that it could happen before Greece runs out of cash to pay loans due Tuesday.
